title: Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra
summary: A robot vacuum and mop that empties itself, washes its own mop pads, and navigates with AI obstacle avoidance. Set it and truly forget it.
editorsNote: Reddit's r/Roborock consistently complains about the dock station being enormous (roughly the size of a small trash can) and hard to hide in a room. The mop function also struggles with dried-on or sticky stains â€” it handles daily maintenance mopping well but won't replace a human mop for deep cleaning. Most users say the set-and-forget convenience outweighs both issues.
content:
How to keep your floors clean without ever thinking about it

Between vacuuming and mopping, floor cleaning eats 2-3 hours per week for the average household. If you have pets, double it. If you have kids, triple it. And it's never done â€” floors get dirty again within a day. Robot vacuums solved half the problem years ago, but they still needed emptying every few days, couldn't mop, and got stuck on everything. The promise of "set it and forget it" cleaning was always aspirational until the latest generation of self-maintaining robots finally delivered on it.

The Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra is the most autonomous floor cleaning robot available. It vacuums AND mops simultaneously, then returns to its dock where it empties its dustbin, washes its mop pads with hot water, dries the pads to prevent mold, and refills its water tank â€” all automatically. You interact with it roughly once every 2-3 weeks to empty the dock's dust bag and refill the clean water reservoir. The AI-powered obstacle avoidance uses a camera and structured light to identify and dodge shoes, cables, pet waste, toys, and other floor clutter in real-time. LiDAR navigation creates centimeter-accurate maps of your home.

The standout features are the VibraRise mopping system (the mop pad vibrates at 4,000 RPM for scrubbing power AND lifts 5mm when carpet is detected, so it vacuums carpet without wetting it), the 6,000Pa suction power (stronger than most handheld vacuums), and per-room customization in the app â€” set different suction and mop intensity levels for the kitchen, bathroom, bedrooms, and living room. Integration with Home Assistant and Alexa means you can trigger cleaning from automations ("vacuum when everyone leaves") or voice commands. Compared to the Roomba j9+, the Roborock adds mopping and a self-maintaining dock at a similar price point.

The real-world impact is eliminating 2-3 hours of weekly floor cleaning â€” that's 100-150 hours per year reclaimed. At $1,000-1,200, it's expensive, but the math is clear: 150 hours saved annually at even $20/hour time value pays for the robot in the first year. Practically, it means your floors are cleaner than they've ever been because the robot runs daily (something no human would do manually). Dust, allergens, and pet hair are continuously removed instead of accumulating between weekly cleanings. Multiple family members report that the Roborock was the single purchase that most improved their daily quality of life.

âš¡ Set it up in 5 minutes

  1. Assemble the dock station â€” connect the water tank, dust bag, and power cord, and place it against a wall with clearance
  2. Download the Roborock app and add the device via Wi-Fi pairing
  3. Run the first mapping pass â€” the robot maps your entire home in about 45 minutes
  4. Name your rooms in the app and set per-room cleaning schedules, suction levels, and mop intensity
  5. Set no-go zones around pet bowls, cables, or areas you want the robot to skip
